  • Latest release: 0.9.0|

Using asset compression
JSP Thymeleaf

Preamble

Dandelion-Datatables allows you to have all your web resources minimified. A compression extra has been written, based on YUI Compressor, allowing you to compress both Javascript and CSS.

Activating asset compression

Two things are needed to enable compression:

  • First, tell Dandelion-Datatables you want to use compress all the generated assets:

    • Setting up the main.compressor.enable property to true in your datatables.properties configuration file. Compression will be turned on in all your application

    • Using the <datatables:prop> JSP tag locally, in a particular table

  • Add the YUI Compressor extra to your classpath

    • Either manually:

      Download the needed JARs and make sure that they are all made available via the application classpath.

    • Or using Maven or another build tool:

      • Maven
      • Gradle
      • Grails
      • Ivy
      • Grape
      • Buildr
      • SBT
      <dependency>
    <groupId>com.github.dandelion</groupId>
    <artifactId>datatables-compression-yui</artifactId>
    <version>0.9.0</version>
</dependency>

      'com.github.dandelion:datatables-compression-yui:0.9.0'

      <dependency org="com.github.dandelion" name="datatables-compression-yui" rev="0.9.0" />

      @Grapes( 
   @Grab(group='com.github.dandelion', module='datatables-compression-yui', version='0.9.0') 
)

      'com.github.dandelion:datatables-compression-yui:jar:0.9.0'

      libraryDependencies += "com.github.dandelion" % "datatables-compression-yui" % "0.9.0"

      compile 'com.github.dandelion:datatables-compression-yui:0.9.0'

Using JSP

<datatables:table id="myTableId" data="${persons}">
   <datatables:column title="Id" property="id" />
   <datatables:column title="FirstName" property="firstName" />
   <datatables:column title="LastName" property="lastName" />
   <datatables:column title="City" property="address.town.name" />
   <datatables:column title="Mail" property="mail" />
   <datatables:prop name="main.compressor.enable" value="true" />
</datatables:table>

Using Thymeleaf

For now, the only way to compress assets with Thymeleaf is to use the main.compressor.enable property in your datatables.properties file.

Configuring the compression

Some options are available, allowing you to configure the compression. Just look at the configuration reference to see what you can do with it.

Using your own compression module

By default, Dandelion-Datatables will use the YuiResourceCompressor of the datatables-compression-yui module but you can also write your own compression module. Here are the needed steps.

  1. Begin writing a class that that implements the WebResourceCompressor interface. 
    package my.package;

public class MyResourceCompressor implements WebResourceCompressor {

   public String getCompressedJavascript(HtmlTable table, String input) throws CompressionException {
      // some stuff...
   }

   public String getCompressedCss(String input) throws CompressionException {
      // some stuff...
   }
}
  2. To activate your own compression module globally, just add the following line in your datatables.properties file: 
    global.main.compressor.class=my.package.MyResourceCompressor
That's all! :-)
